00018 class VTK_SLICER_BASE_EXPORT vtkMrmlNode : public vtkObject
00019 {
00020   public:
00021   static vtkMrmlNode *New();
00022   vtkTypeMacro(vtkMrmlNode,vtkObject);
00023   void PrintSelf(ostream& os, vtkIndent indent);
00024   
00025   // Description:
00026   // Copy a MrmlNode's parameters.
00027   // But don't copy: ID
00028   void MrmlNodeCopy(vtkMrmlNode *node);
00029 
00030   // Description:
00031   // Copy everything from another node of the same type.
00032   // Instances of vtkMrmlNode must define the Copy function.
00033   // Instances of vtkMrmlNode::Copy should call vtkMrmlNode::CopyMrmlNode
00034   virtual void Copy(vtkMrmlNode *node) = 0;
00035   
00036   // Description:
00037   // Set/Get a numerical ID for the calling program to use to keep track
00038   // of its various node objects.
00039   vtkSetMacro(ID, int);
00040   vtkGetMacro(ID, int);
00041 
00042   // Description:
00043   // Text description of this node, to be set by the user
00044   vtkSetStringMacro(Description);
00045   vtkGetStringMacro(Description);
00046 
00047   // Description:
00048   // Name of this node, to be set by the user
00049   vtkSetStringMacro(Name);
00050   vtkGetStringMacro(Name);
00051 
00052   // Description:
00053   // The Title is for use when graphically displaying the 
00054   // contents of a MRML file.
00055   char *GetTitle();
00056 
00057   // Description:
00058   // Node's effect on indentation when displaying the
00059   // contents of a MRML file. (0, +1, -1)
00060   vtkGetMacro(Indent, int);
00061 
00062   // Description:
00063   // Optional attributes not defined in the MRML standard,
00064   // but recognized by various browsers
00065   vtkSetStringMacro(Options);
00066   vtkGetStringMacro(Options);
00067 
00068   // Description:
00069   // Utility functions for converting between vtkMatrix4x4 and
00070   // a string of 16 numbers in row-major order.
00071   void SetMatrixToString(vtkMatrix4x4 *m, char *s);
00072   char* GetMatrixToString(vtkMatrix4x4 *m);
00073 
00074   // Description:
00075   // Write this node's information to a MRML file in XML format.
00076   // Only write attributes that differ from the default values,
00077   // which are set in the node's constructor.
00078   // This is a virtual function that all subclasses must overload.
00079   virtual void Write(ofstream& of, int indent);
00080 
00081 };
